title: How should I persuade my boyfriend from joining the military (Marine Corps)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simple you don’t if you want your relationship to work, as it is up to him to decide what career he does or a living and if you stop him just because you don’t want him to do it, as he will be doing something career wise he doesn’t want to do just to make you happy and ultimately that would destroy your relationship as he would grow to resent you stopping him doing what he wanted to do, Why not try and reach a compromise with him over it whereby he joins the military for the shortest time he can to get the training the offer and he will have got it out of his system before he gets a job in civvy street using the skills he has learnt in the military, and you get a happy future partner who has done what he wanted with his life and got a god training into the bargain before settling down to life in civvy street rather than a resentful one

How should I persuade my boyfriend from joining the military (Marine Corps)? First, if he's sent on joining and you successfully dissuade him from joining, then when he's feeling trapped and miserable you will quickly become an ex girlfriend. Second, you fail to give any real information to provide a rational argument either way. Depending on his intentions behind joining, your strongarm attempts to dissuade him from joining could quickly make you an ex as well. If you want to have a rational discussion with him, you need to understand his mindset for joining. Only then can you lay out your argument and list the pros and cons of him joining.

MY question to you is why would you want to ? If that is his goal or dream , and someone tried to talk me out of it, well either you would try to understand or you would have to go. I never wanted to look back and wonder what would have happened if I pursed my dreams. If you do talk him out of it later on he will regret it. And you will be the one he blames.

You are his girlfriend not his fiance or wife. You don't get to much say in his long term life decisions yet. If you love him you either stand by him and get jobs where he is stationed or if you can't handle it you break up with him before he leaves and tell him to pursue his dreams.
